properties.name: Two-Handed.
properties.desc: This weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.

items.name: Robes
items.desc: A standard set of robes.

items.name: Rod
items.desc: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

items.name: Rope, Hempen (50 feet)
items.desc: Rope, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

items.name: Rope, Silk (50 feet)
items.desc: Rope, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

items.name: Rowboat
items.desc:
If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances.

Rowboats are used on lakes and rivers. If going downstream, add the speed of the current (typically 3 miles per hour) to the speed of the vehicle. These vehicles can’t be rowed against any significant current, but they can be pulled upstream by draft animals on the shores. A rowboat weighs 100 pounds, in case adventurers carry it over land.
Notes: Speed 1 1/2 mph

items.name: Ruby
items.desc: A transparent clear red to deep crimson gemstone worth 5,000 gold pieces

items.name: Sack
items.desc: A sack can hold 1 cubic foot/ 30 pounds of gear.

items.name: Saddle, Exotic
items.desc: An exotic saddle is required for riding any aquatic or flying mount.

items.name: Saddle, Military
items.desc: A military saddle braces the rider, helping you keep your seat on an active mount in battle. It gives you advantage on any check you make to remain mounted.

items.name: Saddle, Pack
items.desc: A standard saddle for a pack mount.

items.name: Saddle, Riding
items.desc: A standard saddle for a riding mount.

items.name: Saddlebags
items.desc: Standard saddlebags that can be attached to a mount's saddle.

items.name: Sailing Ship
items.desc:
If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances.
Notes: Speed 2 mph

items.name: Sardonyx
items.desc: An opaque gemstone with bands of red and white worth 50 gold pieces.

items.name: Scale, Merchant's
items.desc: A scale includes a small balance, pans, and a suitable assortment of weights up to 2 pounds. With it, you can measure the exact weight of small objects, such as raw precious metals or trade goods, to help determine their worth.

items.name: Scholar's Pack
items.desc: Includes a backpack, a book of lore, a bottle of ink, an ink pen, 10 sheets of parchment, a little bag of sand, and a small knife.

items.name: Sealing Wax
items.desc: When you press a signet ring into warm sealing wax, you leave an identifying mark.

items.name: Serpent Venom (Injury)
items.desc:
This poison must be harvested from a dead or incapacitated giant poisonous snake. A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Injury. Injury poison can be applied to weapons, ammunition, trap components, and other objects that deal piercing or slashing damage and remains potent until delivered through a wound or washed off. A creature that takes piercing or slashing damage from an object coated with the poison is exposed to its effects.

items.name: Shawm
items.desc: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

items.name: Shotgun
items.desc: It’s up to you to decide whether a character has proficiency with a firearm. Characters in most D&D worlds wouldn’t have such proficiency. During their downtime, characters can use the training rules in the Player’s Handbook to acquire proficiency, assuming that they have enough ammunition to keep the weapons working while mastering their use.

properties.name: Two-Handed.
properties.desc: This weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.

properties.name: Ammunition
properties.desc: All firearms require ammunition to make an attack, and due to their rare nature, ammunition may be near impossible to find or purchase. However, if materials are gathered, you can craft ammunition yourself using your Tinker’s Tools at half the cost. Each firearm uses its own unique ammunition and is generally sold or crafted in batches listed below next to the price.

properties.name: Reload
properties.desc: The weapon can be fired a number of times equal to its Reload score before you must spend 1 attack or 1 action to reload. You must have one free hand to reload a firearm.

items.name: Shovel
items.desc: A standard shovel used for digging.

items.name: Siberys Dragonshard
items.desc:
Siberys dragonshards fall from the Ring of Siberys, the ring of crystals that encircles the world. While rare in Khorvaire, there are significant shard fields in the continent of Xen’drik, and this is a potential source of great wealth for explorers. Siberys dragonshards are amber in color, with swirling golding veins gleaming within.

Siberys dragonshards have a close affinity to dragonmarks and are a vital part of any dragonmark focus item. Larger shards may be required for eldritch machines or used in the creation of legendary items or artifacts.

items.name: Signal Whistle
items.desc: A small whistle used for signaling.

items.name: Signet Ring
items.desc: Each signet ring has a distinctive design carved into it. When you press this ring into warm sealing wax, you leave an identifying mark.

items.name: Skyship
items.desc:
Speed: 10 mph
Maximum Cargo: 10 tons
Crew: 6–10
Maximum Passenger Occupancy: 30
Personal Travel Cost: 2 gp per mile per passenger
Shipping Cost: 1 gp per 100 pounds per mile

items.name: Sled
items.desc: If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances.

items.name: Sled Dog
items.desc:
Sled dogs must take a short rest after pulling a sled for 1 hour; otherwise, they gain one level of exhaustion.
Notes: Speed 40 ft., Pulling Capacity 360 lbs.

items.name: Sling Bullets
items.desc: Sling bullets are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

items.name: Small Knife
items.desc: A small knife, typically found in a scholar's pack.

items.name: Smith's Tools
items.desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

items.name: Snowshoes
items.desc: Snowshoes reduce the likelihood of their wearer getting stuck in the deep snow.

items.name: Soap
items.desc: A commodity used for bathing.

items.name: Songhorn
items.desc: A recorder, a simple type of flute, usually carved from wood.

items.name: Soothsalts
items.desc:
Soothsalts are derived from a naturally occurring crystalline substance discovered throughout the wilds of the Miskath Strand. The crimson crystals have been mined from cavernous veins like those in the mouth of the Miskath Pit and found within smaller geode formations near sites ravaged by the Calamity. Soothsalts are consumed orally in lozenge-sized doses, and frequent users can be identified by the telltale crimson stain around their mouths. A creature subjected to a dose of soothsalts gains advantage on all Intelligence checks for 1d4 hours.

For each dose of soothsalts consumed, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion—an effect which is cumulative with multiple doses.

items.name: Spellbook
items.desc: Essential for wizards, a spellbook is a leather-bound tome with 100 blank vellum pages suitable for recording spells.

items.name: Spikes, Iron(10)
items.desc: Standard iron spikes typically used with a hammer.

items.name: Spinel
items.desc: A transparent gemstone of red, red-brown, or deep green worth 100 gold pieces

items.name: Springpf Mistletoe
items.desc: A druid can use a Sprig of Mistletoe (or holly) as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

items.name: Spyglass
items.desc: Objects viewed through a spyglass are magnified to twice their size.

items.name: Staff
items.desc: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

items.name: Stake (Wooden)
items.desc: Stakes made out of wood, typically found in a monster hunter's pack.

items.name: Star Rose Quartz
items.desc: A translucent rosy Gemstone with a white star-shaped center worth 50 gold pieces.

items.name: Star Ruby
items.desc: A translucent ruby gemstone with a white star-shaped center worth 1,000 gold pieces.

items.name: Star Sapphire
items.desc: A translucent blue sapphire gemstone with a white star-shaped center worth 1,000 gold pieces.

items.name: String
items.desc: A 10-foot length of string, typically found in a burglar's pack.

items.name: Tangler Grenade
items.desc: A tangler grenade is an alchemical, nonmagical item with an ovoid resin shell that shatters on impact. An as action, a creature can throw a tangler grenade at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of a shattered tangler grenade must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained by sticky white webs. As an action, a creature can try to free itself or another creature within its reach from the webs, doing so with a successful DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check. A gallon of alcohol dissolves the webs produced by a single tangler grenade. Otherwise, the webs dissolve on their own after 1 hour, freeing any creatures restrained by them.

items.name: Tantan
items.desc: A tambourine, a popular instrument with halflings and humans south of the Dalelands.

items.name: Tej
items.desc:
Tej is an amber-colored, fermented drink made from honey. It’s more common and popular in Chult than beer or ale. A mug of tej costs 4 cp in Port Nyanzaru or 6 cp in Fort Beluarian. A 1-gallon cask costs 2 sp in the city or 3 sp at the fort.

Sale of tej is controlled by the merchant prince Kwayothé.

items.name: Tent, Two-Person
items.desc: A simple and portable canvas shelter, a tent sleeps two.

items.name: Theki Root
items.desc: This thick marsh root tastes bitter but is thought to aid digestive health. When you use an action to consume a dose, you gain advantage on saving throws against the effects of poisonous or toxic substances for 8 hours.

items.name: Thelarr
items.desc: Also known as a whistlecane, a simple and easy-to-make wind instrument cut from a reed. They are so simple, in fact, that skilled bards frequently make and give them away to children — to the parents’ delight or regret.

items.name: Thessaltoxin (Ingested or Injury)
items.desc: This poison was first created using blood harvested from the artificer Thessalar. A creature subjected to the poison must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take on a new form as if affected by the polymorph spell. The creature’s new form is a random beast or a creature it has seen within the last 24 hours (as chosen by the DM). This transformation lasts until the end of the target’s next long rest. This effect is not subject to dispel magic or remove curse, but a greater restoration spell restores the creature to its original form.

items.name: Thieve's Tools
items.desc: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.

items.name: Three-Dragon Ante Set
items.desc: If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.

items.name: Tiger Eye
items.desc: A translucent brown gemstone with a golden center worth 10 gold pieces

items.name: Tinderbox
items.desc: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch -- or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel -- takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

items.name: Tinker's Tools
items.desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

items.name: Tocken
items.desc: A hanging set of carved oval bells, usually played with a pair of light wooden hammers (or open handed). They are most common in underground cultures, where the resonant tones can carry.

items.name: Topaz
items.desc: A transparent golden yellow gemstone worth 500 gold pieces

items.name: Torch
items.desc: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

items.name: Torpor (Ingested)
items.desc:
A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 4d6 hours. The poisoned creature is incapacitated.

Ingested. A creature must swallow an entire dose of ingested poison to suffer its effects. The dose can be delivered in food or a liquid. You may decide that a partial dose has a reduced effect, such as allowing advantage on the saving throw or dealing only half damage on a failed save.

items.name: Totem
items.desc: A druid can use a Totem as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

items.name: Tourmaline
items.desc: A transparent pale green, blue, brown, or red gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

items.name: Truth Serum (Ingested)
items.desc:
A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 hour. The poisoned creature can't knowingly speak a lie, as if under the effect of a zone of truth spell.

Ingested. A creature must swallow an entire dose of ingested poison to suffer its effects. The dose can be delivered in food or a liquid. You may decide that a partial dose has a reduced effect, such as allowing advantage on the saving throw or dealing only half damage on a failed save.

items.name: Turquoise
items.desc: An opaque light blue-green gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

items.name: Vestments
items.desc: Religious clothing, typically found in a priest's pack.

items.name: Vial
items.desc: A vial can hold 4 ounces of liquid.

items.name: Viol
items.desc: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

items.name: Wagon
items.desc: If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances.

items.name: Wand
items.desc: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

items.name: Wargong
items.desc: A metal gong, traditionally made from a shield, particularly the shield of an enemy. Both goblins and dwarves make and play wargongs, their sound echoing through tunnels in the Underdark.

items.name: Warhorse
items.desc:
A good mount can help you move more quickly through the wilderness, but its primary purpose is to carry the gear that would otherwise slow you down.

An animal pulling a carriage, cart, chariot, sled, or wagon can move weight up to five times its base carrying capacity, including the weight of the vehicle. If multiple animals pull the same vehicle, they can add their carrying capacity together.
Notes: Speed 60 ft., Carry Capacity 540 lbs.

items.name: Warship
items.desc:
If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances.
Notes: 2 1/2 mph

items.name: Waterskin
items.desc: A waterskin can hold 4 pints of liquid.

items.name: Weaver's Tools
items.desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

items.name: Whetstone
items.desc: A standard whetstone used to sharpen blades.

items.name: Whistle-Stick
items.desc: The grung of One Grung Above are trained to use this new musical instrument. This is a hollow tube with holes cut throughout, much like a flute. You can play music with it for entertainment, but the grung also swing it about by a sturdy cord (attached) to create a sound recognizable by other grung, so they know each other’s approximate location. Additionally, grung that know Thieves’ Cant can use a whistle stick in this manner to communicate over distance.

items.name: Willowshade Oil
items.desc: A dark blue oil can be extracted from the rare fruit of the willowshade plant. A creature can use its action to apply the oil to another creature that has been petrified for less than 1 minute, causing the petrified condition on that creature to end at the start of what would be that creature’s next turn.

items.name: Woodcarver's Tools
items.desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

items.name: Wooden Staff
items.desc: nA druid can use a Wooden Staff as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

items.name: Wyvern Poison (Injury)
items.desc:
This poison must be harvested from a dead or incapacitated wyvern. A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Injury. Injury poison can be applied to weapons, ammunition, trap components, and other objects that deal piercing or slashing damage and remains potent until delivered through a wound or washed off. A creature that takes piercing or slashing damage from an object coated with the poison is exposed to its effects.

items.name: Yarting
items.desc: A southern instrument from Amn and Calimshan that is a Faerûnian analog to the guitar. Numerous variations have spread across the continent.

items.name: Yellow sapphire
items.desc: A transparent fiery yellow or yellow-green gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces

items.name: Yew Wand
items.desc: A druid can use a Yew Wand as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

items.name: Zircon
items.desc: A transparent pale blue-green gemstone worth 50 gold pieces.

items.name: Zulkoon
items.desc: nA complex pump organ that originated with the zulkirs of Thay, who use it in the casting of their spells. It is considered to have a dramatic, but sinister, sound.
